	delsp=yes;
	format=flowed

Note that "TDC" should be "BDC" in the comments in this script


On Dec 4, 2006, at 5:26 AM, David Goodwin wrote:

> Daniele,
>
> Here is a simple cylinder/piston simulation.
>
> ==================================================
> from Cantera import *
> from Cantera.Reactor import *
> from Cantera.Func import *
>
> # unit conversion factors
> mm = 0.001
> cm = 0.01
>
> # piston parameters
> bore = 85.0 * mm
> stroke = 81.0 * mm
> area = Pi*bore*bore/4.0
> disp = stroke * area
> compression_ratio = 9.3
>
> rpm = 2000.0
> freq = rpm * 60.0
> omega = 2*Pi*freq
>
> cyl_height = (1.0/compression_ratio + 1.0)*stroke
> cyl_vol = cyl_height*area
>
> # create a gas object
> gas = GRI30()
> gas.set(T = 300.0, P = OneAtm, X = "CH4:1, O2:2, N2:7.52")
>
> # create a reactor for the cylinder, and a reservoir for the
> # environment
> cyl = Reactor(gas, volume = cyl_vol)
> env = Reservoir(gas)
>
> # the reactor network consists of only one reactor
> sim = ReactorNet([cyl])
>
> # velocity function for the piston. The Fourier coefficients are given
> # as pairs (a_n, b_n). This function is
> # -0.5*omega*stroke*sin(omega*t). For a different periodic function,
> # add the appropriate higher Fourier coefficients.  The piston
> # position will begin at TDC (since the velocity begins at zero and
> # then goes negative) and the amplitude of the oscillation will be the
> # stroke. Not that it is velocity, not position, that is specified!
> # Position is computed.
> v = Fourier(omega, [(0.0, 0.0), (0.0, -0.5*omega*stroke)])
>
> # the piston is a Wall object, installed between the cylinder and
> # environment
> piston = Wall(cyl, env, A = area, velocity = v)
>
> # output file
> f = open('piston.csv','w')
> writeCSV(f, ['time (ms)', 'V (m/s)', 'x', 'T', 'P'])
>
> # advance the simulation in time, and write to the output file
> for n in range(1,100):
>     t = 0.1*n/freq
>     sim.advance(t)
>     writeCSV(f, [t*1000, v(t), cyl.volume()/(cyl_vol),
>                  cyl.temperature(), cyl.pressure()/OneAtm])
>
> f.close()
>
>
> ====================================================================== 
> =====
>
>
> On Dec 1, 2006, at 5:40 AM, dottorato82 wrote:
>
>> Hi,
>> I started using Cantera with Python only one week ago, and I have a
>> question. I woul simulate an ICE piston starting from the reactor, my
>> problem is to define a variable piston velocity, e.g. with a sin
>> function, there's anybody who can help me?
>>
>> Thank You
>>
>> Daniele Chiappini
>> PhD Student
>> Dept. of Mechanical Engineering
>> University of Rome "Tor Vergata"
>>
>>
>>
>>
>> Yahoo! Groups Links
>>
>>
>>
>
> 


--Apple-Mail-10-105472418

Content-Type: text/html;
	charset=ISO-8859-1
